intro: Adenocarpus cebennensis, commonly known as the Cebenna burrgrass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive burr-like seed pods. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. The species is noted for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat.
